# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (rest of year • headline signals from last 30 days)

## 1) Themes to watch
- Offshore wind project development and regulatory challenges, especially US-China-Europe dynamics.
- Solar market expansion and pricing pressures, with emphasis on domestic content rules and manufacturing shifts.
- AI and digital twin applications rising in energy and semiconductor sectors.
- Semiconductor industry investment and operational risks in major US fabs.
- Security threats to critical infrastructure (subsea cables) amid geopolitical tensions.
- Utility business model shifts impacting efficiency and grid flexibility.

## 2) What to monitor next

### Grid / Transmission
- Flexible grid connections mandated for community solar in US states.
- Security risks highlighted by Finnish police seizing a ship suspected of damaging subsea cables.

### Renewables
- Orsted’s $5 billion offshore wind project halted by US, indicating regulatory/political hurdles.
- China leads offshore wind turbine capacity; Vestas installs 15 MW units offshore.
- UK solar forecasted for record CfD deployment in 2026.
- India mandates 20% domestic content in battery storage projects.
- Large-scale solar projects advancing in India (Waaree Energies 20+ GW ALMM approved) and Bangladesh (220 MW tender).
- Solar module price trends in China targeting CNY 1/W mark.

### Oil & Gas
- Not enough information in the headlines.

### Data Centers & AI
- AI “inference economics” flagged as key trend by Plexo Capital.
- Deepwater’s Doug Clinton sees AI trade continuing for several more years.
- New digital twin using AI applied to floating PV installations.

### Semiconductors
- Intel Arizona fab’s fate described as uncertain, signaling operational/strategic pressure.
- China wafer suppliers raising quotes affecting module prices.

### Rare Earth / Critical Minerals
- Not enough information from headlines on rare earths or minerals supply chain; but India domestic content rules in battery storage hint at strategic material sourcing focus.

## 3) Regions / companies appearing repeatedly
- Regions: US, China, UK, India, Bangladesh, Finland (subsea cable incident).
- Companies: Orsted, Vestas, Tata Power Renewable, Waaree Energies, Apollo (offshore wind co-owner), Intel.

## 4) Constraints/risks implied by headlines
- Regulatory and political risks delaying or halting offshore wind projects (Orsted US halt).
- Rising solar manufacturing costs due to wafer supplier price increases in China.
- Potential project exits by key solar manufacturers (Eging in China).
- Utility tariff design shifts may discourage efficiency due to fixed charge adoption.
- Infrastructure vulnerability highlighted by subsea cable attack and geopolitical tensions (Russian crew detained).

---

This watchlist aggregates operational, regulatory, and market signals from the past 30 days relevant to energy infrastructure, renewables, AI integration, semiconductor investments, and supply chain security.
